data_table.description: TIA/Stroke, Exam 3. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: TIAD23
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden numbness, tingling, or loss of feeling on one side of your body? Q23 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD24
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Did the feeling of numbness or tingling occur only when you kept your arms or legs in a certain position? Q24 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD25
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this time, how many episodes of numbness, tingling, or loss of sensation have you had? Q25 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAD26
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q26 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year ago
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years ago
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAD27
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q27 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAD28
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q28 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD28A
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q28a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAD29A
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left arm or hand. Q29a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29B
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left leg or foot. Q29b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29C
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left side of face. Q29c [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29D
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right arm or hand. Q29d [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29E
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right foot or leg. Q29e [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29F
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right side of face. Q29f [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD29G
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During the (worst) episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Other. Q29g [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD30
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. During this episode, did the abnormal sensation start in one part of your body and spread to another, or did it stay in the same place? Q30 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: In one part and spread to another

variable.name: TIAD31A
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbance. Q31a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31B
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q31b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31C
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Did you have difficulty on. Q31c [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31D
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q31d [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31E
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q31e [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31F
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q31f [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31G
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q31g [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31H
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Pain in the numb or tingling arm, leg or face. Q31h [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31I
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. While you were having your (worst) episode of numbness, tingling or loss of sensation, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances. Q31i [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD31J
variable.description: [Sudden numbness or tingling]. Did you have. Q31j [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the right
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the left

variable.name: TIAD32
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden episodes of paralysis or weakness on one side of your body? Q32 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD33
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this time, how many episodes of paralysis or weakness have you had? Q33 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAD34
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this same time period, when did the earliest occur? Q34 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Greater than 6 months, but less than 1 year ago
Greater than 1 year, but less than 2 years ago
Greater than 2 years, but less than 3 years ago

variable.name: TIAD35
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. How long did it (the longest episode) last? Q35 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: At least 30 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 3 minutes
At least 3 minutes, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 6 hours
At least 6 hours, but less than 12 hours
At least 12 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAD36
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. Did the (worst) episode come on suddenly? Q36 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD36A
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. How long did it take for the symptoms to get as bad as they were going to get? Q36a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: At least 3 seconds, but less than 1 minute
At least 1 minute, but less than 1 hour
At least 1 hour, but less than 2 hours
At least 2 hours, but less than 24 hours

variable.name: TIAD37A
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left arm or hand. Q37a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37B
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left leg or foot. Q37b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37C
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Left side of face. Q37c [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37D
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right arm or hand. Q37d [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37E
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right foot or leg. Q37e [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37F
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Right side of face. Q37f [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD37G
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, which part or parts of your body were affected? Other. Q37g [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD38
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. During this episode, did the paralysis or weakness start in one part of your body and spread to another, or did it stay in the same place? Q38 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Started in one part and spread to another

variable.name: TIAD39A
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbances. Q39a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39B
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q39b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39C
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. Did you have difficulty on. Q39c [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39D
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Lightheadedness or dizzy spells. Q39d [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39E
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q39e [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39F
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q39f [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39G
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q39g [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39H
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Pain in the weak arm, leg or face. Q39h [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39I
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. While you were having your worst episode of paralysis or weakness, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances. Q39i [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD39J
variable.description: [Sudden paralysis or weakness]. Did you have: Q39j [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the right
Trouble in both eyes seeing to the left

variable.name: TIAD40
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden spells of dizziness, loss of balance, or sensation of spinning? Q40 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD41
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. Did the dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation occur only when changing the position of your head or body? Q41 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42A
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Speech disturbances. Q42a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42B
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Paralysis or weakness. Q42b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42C
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. Did you have difficulty on. Q42c [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42D
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q42d [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42E
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. Did you have difficulty on. Q42e [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42F
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Blackouts or fainting. Q42f [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42G
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Seizures or convulsions. Q42g [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42H
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q42h [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42I
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. While you were having your (worst) episode of dizziness, loss of balance or spinning sensation, did any of the following occur? Visual disturbances. Q42i [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD42J
variable.description: [Sudden spells of dizziness or loss of balance]. Did you have: Q42j [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: Vision loss in right eye only
Vision loss in left eye only
Total loss of vision in both eyes

Trouble in both eyes seeing to the left

variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIADFLAG
variable.description: Indicator for presence of form [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIADCY
variable.description: Contact year [7] [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD1
variable.description: [Medical history]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you been told by a physician that you had a stroke, slight stroke, transient ischemic attack or transient ischemic attack [TIA]? Q1 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD3
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Since the last ARIC visit, have you had any sudden loss or changes in speech? Q3 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: TIAD4
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. During this time, how many episodes of loss or changes in speech have you had? Q4 [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
variable.value: More than 20, or frequent, intermittent events, too numerous to count

variable.name: TIAD9A
variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. While you were having your (worst) episode of change in speech, did any of the following occur? Numbness or tingling. Q9a [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.description: [Sudden loss or change of speech]. Did you have difficulty on. Q9b [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.description: [Double vision]. While you were having your (worst episode of) double vision, did any of the following occur? Headache. Q22i [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]

variable.name: GWAS_ID
variable.description: ARIC participant ID [TIA/Stroke, exam 3]
